def welcome_to_blog():
  # print welcome message
  print("Welcome to my blog.")
  
welcome_to_blog()

# output
# Welcome to my blog.
source.6665aa97:
def welcome_to_blog(name):
  # print welcome message
  message = "Hello " + name.title() + ", Welcome to blog."
  print(message)
  
welcome_to_blog('Durgesh')
source.e115c31f:
def welcome_to_blog(name):
  # print welcome message
  message = "Hello " + name.title() + ", Welcome to blog."
  print(message)
  
welcome_to_blog('Durgesh')
welcome_to_blog('John')
welcome_to_blog('Jessica')
source.49fc18c7:
class users():
  def __init__(self, name):
    self.name = name
  
  def greetings(self):
    print("Hello ", self.name.title())
    
user1 = users('James')
user1.greetings()

# output
# Hello, James

user1 = users('Jessica')
user1.greetings()

# output
# Hello, Jessica

source.3899179a: ## Making Instance and Call Methods from Class
source.1aa078f4:
Today we learned the Basics of python from Python Crash Course book (Chapters 8 and 9). My goal for this 100 Days of Machine Learning Challenge is to learn machine learning from scratch and help others who want to start their journey in machine learning. Many concepts are known to me, but I am starting from scratch to help beginners of the Machine Learning community and revise concepts.

Thanks for Reading!
